description: This component allows fitting label contents to the specified width by changing the font size.

maxFontSize.description: Max font size of the label element.

maxWidth.description: Max width of the label container element.

minFontSize.description: Min font size of the label element.

textPosition.description:
Position of the text of the label.
It applies given position to text if label width is greater than the text width.

componentSize.description:
Defines size of the component. The ComponentSize constant is exported from enums.
@ignore

context.description: Defines application requirements such as localization, theme, platform.

disabled.description: If true, all component functionalities are disabled.

id.description: All components must have an id prop.

snapKey.description:
The snapKey property is used to manage snapshots of the child components.
@ignore

snapshot.description:
In our SPA, we want to keep the state of each component when a page unmounts.
And when the same page mounts again, the component mounts with the snapshot prop and
it gets the previous state.
@ignore

style.description: All components must have a style prop.

valueConstraint.description: The valueConstraint is used for validations on components like limit, required, etc.

visible.description: In the ComponentComposer, we change the visibility of the component with this prop.
